subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Question...
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
The Trifield 100XE is a good all-around EMF meter. A lot of people use
them on ghost hunts. I've borrowed one from a friend once in a while.
You should do fine with it.

The Natural EMF meter is supposed to be more sensitive to fields in a
lower frequency range that are emitted by living things (or ghosts).
It is supposed to reduce sensitivity to the frequency used by house
wiring, I believe, so this does not affect it so much.

I think both are sensitive to the human range of fields.

Experiment with it and have fun!

Zack

>>
>> This device is misused by almost everybody!  This is because the manual
>> sucks and the TV people use it wrong consistently.  To figure it out, I
>> contacted the manufacturer a couple years back and this is what they told
>> me.
>>
>> Always us the Trifield in Magnetic mode.  If the box is stable and there
>> is
>> no lightning, the box should not sound an alarm unless something
>> paranormal
>> is happening (or you move your digital recorder to close to it, magnetized
>> speakers).  If you use electric or combination, you can, and will, pick up
>> the body electric with every motion and may receive many false positives.
>>  The meter should also never be used while walking because this too gives
>> unreliable readings.  There is nothing worse than seeing some TV schmuck
>> holding it in their hands and claiming something paranormal is going on
>> because an alarm is sounding, never mind that the camera is right next to
>> it
>> emitting magnetism through the mic / internal speaker.
>>
>> Also, the name trifield is a misnomer.  It only has one plane of reading,
>> not three!  The yellow one (AC) has three fields.  The natural trifield
>> only
>> measures the plane that extends from the top and bottom edges lengthwise
>> from the devices.  So if you have the device sitting upright, you will
>> only
>> measure whatever is above the device.  If you have it laying flat, you
>> will
>> be able to measure the full plane of length extending beyond the bottom
>> and
>> top edges.  Therefore, it is best to use this device slightly elevated and
>> laying flat.
>>
>> Using it in this fashion has yielded some amazing results thus far.  While
>> it is rare for this meter to fire when used properly, when a "spirit"
>> understands how to trigger the alarm you can get conversations that can
>> last
>> upwards of an hour.  I have experiences this only 6 times in all the years
>> I
>> have investigated.  Most of the time, this device yields a single alarm,
>> or
>> maybe two, with no real time interaction with questions.
>>
